question.text: A man with genotype <math><mtext>EEFfGgHH</mtext></math> can produce a <math><mi>(P)</mi></math> number of genetically different sperms and a woman with genotype <math><mtext>LLMmNnOo</mtext></math> can produce <math><mi>(Q)</mi></math> number of genetically different eggs. Determine the values of <math><mtext>(P) and (Q).</mtext></math>

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math>

solution.text:
A man with genotype EEFfGgHH can produce 4 number of genetically different sperms as the individual is heterozygous for two gene locus. Woman with genotype LLMmNnOo can produce 8 number of genetically different eggs as she is heterozygous for three gene locus.

The number of gametes formed can be calculated by the formula (2)n, where n = no. of heterozygous genes.
